events.event_description: U.S. solar construction costs increased by 1.7% to $1,588 per kilowatt in 2022, driven primarily by a 13% increase in crystalline silicon tracking panel costs.
events.citation: Average U.S. solar construction costs across all solar panel types increased 1.7% to $1,588 per kilowatt (kW) in 2022. The increase was primarily driven by a 13% increase in the construction cost for crystalline silicon tracking panels, which increased to $1,605/kW, the highest price since 2018.

events.event_description: U.S. onshore wind turbine construction costs rose 1.6% to $1,451/kW in 2022, with larger wind farms (100-200 MW) seeing a 10% cost increase.
events.citation: The average construction cost for U.S. onshore wind turbines increased 1.6% in 2022 to $1,451/kW. Higher costs were driven by increases in construction costs for wind farms greater than 100 megawatts (MW) in nameplate capacity. The cost for wind farms between 100 MW and 200 MW of capacity increased by 10% to $1,614/kW.

events.event_description: Natural gas-fired generator construction costs decreased 11% in 2022, with combined-cycle facilities seeing a dramatic 42% cost reduction to $722/kW.
events.citation: The average construction cost for natural gas-fired generators fell 11% between 2021 and 2022. The decrease was driven primarily by decreases in the cost for combined-cycle facilities. The average construction cost for generators at combined-cycle facilities fell by 42% in 2022 to $722/kW.

events.event_description: Total investment in new U.S. electric-generating capacity decreased by 27% from 2021 to $36.9 billion in 2022.
events.citation: Investment in new electric-generating capacity in 2022 decreased by 27% from 2021 to $36.9 billion dollars.
